Description: Rim and floor fragment of Ionian pottery plate; interior: maeander band on rim; band at edge of floor; inside, lotus flower and tongue frieze with added red; exterior: three bands preserved; six repair holes preserved.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the National Museum of Scotland. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.700)
CVA Edinburgh / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum National Museums of Scotland Edinburgh (p.4, pl. 3, 12)
